page.title: 01LOCHALSH BLOCK
page.content: The Lochalsh block lies on the north and south banks at the head of Loch Alsh where it meets the outflow from Loch Duich and Loch Long.The block is dissected by the Inverness to Kyle of Lochalsh road.There are four small communities in the block.Auchtertyre is the biggest and has a primary school.The three others,Avernish, Nostie and Ardelve were formally fishing villages.Tourism is important as many of the houses now are being used as holiday homes.There is a caravan site and most of the occupied houses take bed and breakfast.At the western end of the block the Loch Duich Hotel has a commanding position. The area has been populated for many centuries and the most important historical site is a Broch which was built in Viking times.
